item.title: Main Deck Cargo Smoke Detector System – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided smoke detector system integrity is verified before each departure.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "MAIN CARGO DECK SMOKE DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify integrity of main deck cargo smoke detection system as follows:
Select either one of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2090 Ground Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 bulkhead in the left main equipment center located near upper left side of ladder.
Set CDU to the CMC main menu and press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM.
Press LINE SELECT key to initiate FIRE/OVHT TEST. TEST IN PROGRESS will display for the duration of the test. Upon completion of the test, TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL will be displayed on the CDU.
If TEST PASSED is displayed, system integrity is verified.
If FIRE TEST FAIL is displayed:

note.para: FIRE TEST FAIL may appear because of a fault in a different fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: Verify the following EICAS/CMC fault messages do not appear on the CDU:

entry.para: CARGO FIRE SIGNAL> MM-A CARD FAIL
CARGO FIRE SIGNAL> MM-B CARD FAIL

numlitem.para: If the above EICAS/CMC fault messages appear, seek corrective action: dispatch is not allowed.
Check for the following EICAS status messages:

para.emphasis: Freighter aircraft with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System:

numlitem.para: For each of the above EICAS status messages displayed, dispatch is allowed provided the associated cargo zone remains empty and:
* The associated zone(s) and the zone immediately forward of the associated zone(s) remain empty for above CMC fault message(s) listed and followed by one asterisk (*).
** The associated zone(s) and the two zones immediately forward of the associated zone(s) remain empty for above CMC fault message(s) listed and followed by two asterisks (**).
*** For detection zones 12 and/or 13, zones 10, 11, 12 and 13 remain empty.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
